char_info.desc: The Maiden Who Converts Determination to Strength

a0.speaker: Youmu:
a0.dialogue: Beyond the Divide, I spy a mysterious 'thing' with pillars over there.

a1.speaker: Youmu:
a1.dialogue: Based on how they look, I bet they are not ordinary pillars but ones from the Outside World where bells are placed inside.

a2.speaker: Youmu:
a2.dialogue: If I recall correctly, a while ago Sumireko said these are called ‘belfries’, according to what Reimu told me.

a3.speaker: Youmu:
a3.dialogue: Now one question remains: Why are they even there in the first place? Is this supposed to be a stage?

a4.speaker: Emiri:
a4.dialogue: Milady needs these for her prayers.

a5.speaker: Emiri:
a5.dialogue: Every morning, noon, and evening, the bells in the belfries should ring to tell her it is time for prayers.

a6.speaker: Emiri:
a6.dialogue: I, Emiri Kanzaki, even though I have graduated from the Narukamites, still work as her bodyguard from time to time.

a7.speaker: Emiri:
a7.dialogue: I am responsible for various things she needs, including the ringing of the prayer bells.

a8.speaker: Youmu:
a8.dialogue: I guess I have guessed correctly what these towers are used for.

a9.speaker: Youmu:
a9.dialogue: But the single idea of bells for prayer time is just outright bizarre.

a10.speaker: Emiri:
a10.dialogue: You aren't even aware of the practices that members of the Church practice.

a11.speaker: Emiri:
a11.dialogue: Yeah, I know you are not aware of this because you live in a secluded pagan land.

a12.speaker: Emiri:
a12.dialogue: But simply put, our Church has several devotional practices, some of which are very well known and others are not.

a13.speaker: Emiri:
a13.dialogue: Although it is evident that Christmas practices are everywhere in the world...

a14.speaker: Emiri:
a14.dialogue: They are modified heavily because of secularization.

a15.speaker: Youmu:
a15.dialogue: Sumireko told me about that thing before.

a16.speaker: Youmu:
a16.dialogue: Albeit she said that if you want us to celebrate that holiday here, it is like turkeys voting for Christmas.

a17.speaker: Emiri:
a17.dialogue: Say it again, you punching bag swordswoman!

a18.speaker: Emiri:
a18.dialogue: You dare to say that if I want to practice my faith here, I am about to bring devastation to myself!?

a19.speaker: Youmu:
a19.dialogue: Nothing! I... I mean, what Sumireko said to me actually means something else different!

a20.speaker: Emiri:
a20.dialogue: I guess the land you are coming from must be a secret last bastion of the Shogunate.

a21.speaker: Emiri:
a21.dialogue: Based on what you have just said about me following the Church's teachings in that place...

a22.speaker: Emiri:
a22.dialogue: You are gonna have to try a little harder than that, twerp. I won't have a downfall!
